observation: You have navigated to the course page for "Spacecraft Dynamics Capstone: Mars Mission" offered by the University of Colorado Boulder. The course is designed for advanced learners and is part of the Spacecraft Dynamics and Control Specialization. It requires approximately 43 hours to complete over a flexible schedule. The main subjects covered include the application of three-dimensional kinematics for orbit simulation, evaluating orbit frame orientation, rigid body kinematics for attitude reference frames, and numerical simulation of spacecraft attitude dynamics. However, this course is not specifically labeled as a 'Guided Project'; it is a Capstone course designed for completing a specialization, but it does relate to astrophysics through its focus on spacecraft dynamics.
